content.text:
# Analysis of the Main Target Image

## Count & Layers
- The structure has a total of 8 blocks
- There are 4 main layers (from bottom to top)
  * Bottom layer (1st): 2 blocks (1 green, 1 orange)
  * 2nd layer: 2 blocks (1 green, 1 orange)
  * 3rd layer: 2 blocks (1 blue cube, 1 orange rectangle)
  * Top layer (4th): 2 triangular orange roof pieces

## Spatial Relationships
- Bottom layer: A green cube and an orange cube side by side
- 2nd layer: A green cube and an orange cube side by side, placed directly on top of the bottom layer blocks
- 3rd layer: A blue cube on one side and an orange rectangular piece on the other side
- Top layer: Two triangular orange roof pieces forming a peaked roof

# Block Selection from Dictionary

Based on my analysis, I need the following blocks from the dictionary:
- Green cubes (index 2) - 2 needed
- Orange cubes (index 3) - 2 needed
- Blue cube (index 1) - 1 needed
- Blue rectangular block (index 8) - 1 needed
- Orange roof triangular pieces (index 12 and index 15) - 2 needed

List of required block indices: 2, 2, 3, 3, 1, 8, 12, 15

# Assembly Order

```
{
    Step1: Move block with index 2
    Step2: Move block with index 3
    Step3: Move block with index 2
    Step4: Move block with index 3
    Step5: Move block with index 1
    Step6: Move block with index 8
    Step7: Move block with index 12
    Step8: Move block with index 15
}
```

This sequence builds the structure from the bottom up, starting with the base layer and working upward to the roof pieces.
